task_1.eligibility_criteria: Vendors must possess a valid business license, demonstrate financial stability through audited financial statements, and have at least three years of experience in supplying office products.
task_1.submission_requirements: Proposals must be submitted in PDF format by the specified deadline, including a cover letter, detailed pricing, delivery schedules, and references from at least two previous clients.
task_1.evaluation_criteria: Proposals will be evaluated based on cost-effectiveness (40%), product quality (30%), delivery timelines (20%), and vendor reputation (10%).
task_1.conflict_of_interest_guidelines: All employees involved in the procurement process must disclose any personal relationships with vendors and refrain from participating in the evaluation if a conflict exists.

task_2.needs_assessment: Department heads must submit a detailed request form outlining the specific medical equipment needed, including justification for the purchase and estimated budget, for approval by the procurement committee.
task_2.vendor_selection: The procurement team will issue a request for proposals to pre-qualified vendors, evaluate submissions based on technical specifications, and conduct interviews if necessary.
task_2.purchase_approval: All purchases exceeding $50,000 require approval from the hospital's executive board, accompanied by a detailed report of the evaluation process and selected vendor.
task_2.delivery_and_inspection: Upon delivery, the equipment must be inspected by the hospital's biomedical engineering team to ensure compliance with specifications before final acceptance and payment processing.
